to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

Electoral College (of the United States)

sentences.english: Altogether, there are 538 electoral votes (including three for the District of Columbia, even though it has no voting representatives in Congress).
Chapter 5 is about the regional distribution of Juren in shandong in Qing dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 第五章清代山东举人的区域分布研究。

sentences.english: When the nation began, the legislatures mostly named electors directly.
sentences.chinese: 在建国之初，议会通常直接指定选举人。

sentences.english: It set new rules for counting the electoral votes of the states.
sentences.chinese: 它为计数各州选举人票的新规则。

sentences.english: The presidential race is decided by a state-by-state tally of electoral votes.
sentences.chinese: 总统竞选按各州选举人票的票数决定。

sentences.english: The Electoral College Plan itself was the compromise of various interests at the constitutional convention in 1787.
sentences.chinese: 总统选举人团方案本身就是各种利益妥协的结果。

sentences.english: According to my family record, my late grandfather was a second degree candidate in the provincial examination.
sentences.chinese: 根据家谱的记载，我的先祖是清末一名举人。

sentences.english: I admire you for a long time.
Exams give money to a larger number of quality, have to own account on the signature or initialed.
sentences.chinese: 质举人举钱数目较大，还得自己在帐上签名或画押。

sentences.english: Quality libraries to the quality of lifts, "quality of money post" as a ransom material evidence.
sentences.chinese: 质库给质举人“质钱帖子”作为赎物凭证。

sentences.english: Without any modesty, Chu Jen Wang sat down in the seat of honour.
sentences.chinese: 王举人也不谦让，一屁股在上首坐了。

sentences.english: The states Mr. Trump won held 306 electoral votes.
sentences.chinese: 特朗普拿下的各州则持有306张选举人票。

sentences.english: Independent voters are having second thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 独立选举人正在另作考虑。

sentences.english: Voters are telling  the Congress to shove its new tax plan.
sentences.chinese: 选举人让国会把新税法报废。

sentences.english: The lists of candidates shall be submitted to the Party organizations and voters for full deliberation and discussion.
sentences.chinese: 候选人名单要由党组织和选举人充分酝酿讨论。

sentences.english: Only one Republican elector has publicly said he will not vote for Trump.
sentences.chinese: 只有一位选举人公开表示不会投票给川普。

definition: successful candidate in the highest imperial civil service examination/palace graduate
a person who has passed the county level imperial exam (historical)/scholar/skillful writer/fine talent
candidate for the Imperial Examination proposed by a tributary state
the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
to pass an exam
title of the temporary position in the Hanlin Academy, conferred to meritorious candidates until the next examination
scholar preparing for imperial examinations (in former times)
to pass the provincial level imperial examination
candidate who has not yet passed the county level imperial exam
first-placed candidate in the provincial imperial examinations (old)
(old) candidate who has successfully passed the first grades of the examination system, but not yet the court examination (殿試|殿试[dian4 shi4])
successful military candidate in the imperial provincial examination
imperial examination
court examination, the top grade imperial exam
county head magistrate (old)
the last of the three entry-level exams in the imperial examination system of Ming and Qing dynasties
